qas.question: Each Tennessee county must elect which law enforcement official?
Which law enforcement entity serves warrants in Tennessee?
Who is in charge of policing Tennessee counties' unincorporated areas?
Who polices incorporated areas of Tennessee's counties?
What proportion of Tennessee counties recognize their Sheriff as their head law enforcement official?

context: Local law enforcement is divided between <a2_0>County Sheriff<a2_0/>'s Offices and <a3_0>Municipal Police Departments<a3_0/>. Tennessee's Constitution requires that each County have an elected <a0_0>Sheriff<a0_0/>. In <a4_0>94 of the 95<a4_0/> counties the Sheriff is the chief law enforcement officer in the county and has jurisdiction over the county as a whole. Each <a1_0>Sheriff's Office<a1_0/> is responsible for warrant service, court security, jail operations and primary law enforcement in the unincorporated areas of a county as well as providing support to the municipal police departments. Incorporated municipalities are required to maintain a police department to provide police services within their corporate limits.
